intro: Altamiranoa jurgensenii, commonly known as the Jurgensen's altamiranoa, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces striking yellow-orange inflorescences that emerge from the base of the leaves, attracting various pollinators. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is often found in protected areas. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important subject for botanical research.
